newsitem.title: CHINA: China puts new oilfield into operation.
newsitem.headline: China puts new oilfield into operation.

text.p: The first phase project of a new oilfield in eastern China has gone into operation since April, with daily output of about 100 tonnes of crude oil, officials said on Wednesday.

The Tainan oilfield, based in Dongtai city in eastern Jiangsu province, had total investment of 100 million yuan ($12 million), an official of the East China Bureau of Petroleum told Reuters from Nanjing, capital of the Jiangsu province.
The oilfield has 20 wells, 10 of which have already begun production, the official said.
"Crude from the oilfield is to meet domestic demand," he said but gave no further details.
